name: Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas

reviews.text: I accidentally booked my co-worker and I into this hotel for a recent business trip to Dallas (we had planned to stay at the Ritz but I confused the two). This is located in Irving. Arriving late at night, the property seemed to be in the middle of nowhere but it was about a 15-20 minute drive into Dallas where we needed to be. There was a nice flat screen TV, mini-bar, complementary fruit and water. Bathroom was large with separate shower and bath. L'Occitane products. Decent hair dryer. Nice robes. Used the overnight pressing service and they returned my suit at the time I asked for it.
reviews.title: Nice property

reviews.text: Room service was ok. I ordered scrambled eggs and they were runny and inedible. I was disappointed considering the $30 price tag.
reviews.title: Good, But some minor issues.

reviews.text: We ate dinner and had cocktails in the hotel bar. Good food and the "pie-flavored" cocktails were very rich and delicious. Good local beers available too.
reviews.title: Oasis in Dallas

likes.liked: — Wonderfully modern room and Four Seasons service

reviews.text: The only real complaint I have is I did notice some stains on the sheets unfortunately not before I slept in the bed. Yuck. I would assume the property would have taken care of that problem had I discovered it promptly. But also not really a ringing endorsement if housekeeping didn't see it. It was large and red and really unpleasant.
reviews.title: Great for the business traveler

likes.disliked: — Need wireless internet in all the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is in a good location, close to Dallas Airport. It is well decorated, and comfortable.
reviews.title: The pool and gym were fantastic. The room was dated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I had the pleasure of staying FOUR nights at this location. During our stay the staff were very nice to us to a point that they were call us by our last names! We experienced the gym which had excellent equipment and trainers. Outdoor patio and 19th bar for drinks were great. Outdoor pool was not heated but hot tub was great! If you are a golfer, bring down your clubs! Excellent driving range but even better pratice putting and short game area! To pay between $125-195 to play at TPC not worth it. But experience the pratice area it's worth working on your short game. Room was overall good with a good bed to sleep on every night. Overall a very nice hotel if you are paying around $200 per night. Take advantage of the gym, pool and golf pratice areas. You will really enjoy your stay by experiencing these extras at this hotel.
reviews.title: Service ++++++

reviews.text: It's a large hotel, on a golf course. I had a large room in a small building on the golf course. Everything was clean, very good quality and well done. Restaurant food was excellent, and the staff was Four Seasons excellent.
reviews.title: Very beautiful and comfortable

reviews.text: I have stayed at this Four Seasons twice - both times for business.
reviews.title: Very well looked after!

likes.liked: — The staff, the sports facilities, the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both times it surprised me.
reviews.title: average stay at Four Seasons

likes.disliked: — High priced villa that was supposedly new had 3 issues that were in need of repair

reviews.text: One of the things I find the most important when staying at resorts such as these is the staff. And here the staff were fantastic, always so happy to help, and never forgot our names! Most people even remembered our names when we returned 7 weeks later! For a chain hotel (and I understand that this is one of the biggest Four Seasons) I was hugely impressed.
reviews.title: Relaxing Large Resort

likes.disliked: — felt a bit impersonal due to the large size

reviews.text: A last minute business trip brought to the Four Season Las Colinas. I'd attended for a conference, but I found that the hotel had a special that provided me with a villa upgrade and a percent discount off my amenities resulting in a significantly decreased cost to me than I would've received if I booked the conference rate. The villa room was amazing and overlooked the golf course. It was a fairly minor distance from the villa to the main hotel function space. (I only note it because I was wearing uncomfortable heels...). The staff was incredibly friendly and accomodating and assisted me with locating my banquet room at 4:30am by walking with me so I wouldn't get lost. They also called the banquet staff to assist me with my shipped meeting items. I dined in the restaurant for a buffet breakfast before I left and it was amazingly delicious and the wait staff were more than helpful. If you're a golfer you will love this place. Or if you're simply looking for an spa escape, you'll love this place. I doubt I'll be returning to the Dallas area anytime soon, but if I were, I would book this place in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: This property is a large golf resort. The rooms inside the main building are smaller than the villas. The thing with the villas (I was there in winter) is that it's a distance to the main lobby. So in order to get back and forth, you have to call the golf cart. That's nobody's fault, it just is.
reviews.title: Middle of the road Four Seasons

reviews.text: Four Seasons has some new properties, and some old ones. This property is 22 years old, but it doesn't show its age, other than it doesn't have what I call the new Four Seasons 3.0 look that exists in Seattle and St. Louis with the "blond" wood coloring. Room service is good, spa is good, service is good. It's nice. You won't be disappointed, but you won't be blown away either.
reviews.title: Top of the line with great service

reviews.text: Quite a memorable experience. Absolutely beautiful property with extraordinary service and excellent food. Rooms are wonderful (was in a villa overlooking the golf course). Fitness center is one of the most impressive I have seen anywhere. Did not have the opportunity to play tennis, but the courts looked terrific.
reviews.title: Nice Golf Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the Double Bed Villas by the childrens pool which were very nice and secluded. The family pool area is very nice with a small kiddie pool that is very shallow so my young ones (ages 3 and 2) were able to play comfortably in the water. The bigger pool does have shallow areas as well. There is a big beach area with sand and sand toys for the kids to play in as well as water toys for them to take into the pool. The breakfast buffet was excellent every morning! I would definetly stay here again but probably in the summer where the kids could get more enjoyment out of the pool area. My husband did enjoy playing the golf course which you can only play if you are members or guests of the hotel. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Because we were traveling with kids they received welcome cookies and milk in the room as well as kid size bath robes. They really enjoyed it as did we!
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Four Seasons at Las Colinas for my husband's Father's Day gift. We arrived a little before check-in time and were told it would be a few minutes before our room was ready. Within just a few minutes the front desk called and told us they were ready for us. We had a Villa room on the 18th green of the TPC Las Colinas golf course. It was an older room, but very well appointed. We had a separate shower and a large jetted tub. We had a nice view of the putting green and a large flat screen TV (which my husband was glad about). We were going to ask if we could purchase the bed at check-out-it was that comfortable. The pool area is very nice and the attendants were constantly bringing me water and asking if everything was OK. The service was top knotch at this resort and only had one minor inconvenience when we needed to remind housekeeping that our room had not been made up the second day. We left for a little while to visit the pool and they quickly cleaned our room for us. My husband remarked at how quiet the room was. We were able to sleep past 9:00 everyday and never heard a soul. The only thing I would mention when visiting this property is that they do charge for everything! Upon check-out we used valet parking the first night and it was $22.00 plus the tip we gave the valet attendant. A pina colada by the pool was $11.50 and a canned coke on the golf course was $4.50. Most people who stay in five star resorts may be accustomed to this, but we were shocked by it. Fortunately we took advantage of a promotion they have going called the Escape package where all incidentals at the resort were 25% off-so that helped with the sticker shock. We will definitely visit this property again-especially with our children. They will love the pool area, but we will just be more cautious of the extras.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing weekend at the Four Seasons

reviews.text: I stayed at the Four Seasons in Las Colinas for one night in mid-June, 2009 prior to an early morning flight out of DFW Airport. Perhaps I missed something but I might as well have been staying at a Marriott for slightly less $$$. My room -- #974 -- was in the main tower complex on the top level and looked out over the parking area. Upon check-in I was told that I had been upgraded through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts to a higher category room and that this was a recently renovated room but I find that very difficult to believe.
reviews.title: A very average hotel -- Not a typical luxurious Four Seasons Experience

reviews.text: The room was very dark and unwelcoming. Everything seemed brown. The furniture was newer but the flooring was stained. There was nothing on the walls -- not even bad art. The stone countertop in the bathroom was etched and had lots of white water ring marks in it. Even the shower stall seemed like it had seen better days -- not dirty but not brand new. The bathtub spout dripped and the magnifying mirror on/off switch had been broken off so that it stayed on 24/7. The lighting in the bath was horrible for applying make-up and there was no other option as the bath contained the only mirror.
reviews.title: Very nice older property

reviews.text: A previous reviewed mentioned the Bulgvri toiletries -- not anymore. Now they are using L'Occatine. Not bad but not the typical Four Seasons style. The towels were soft and fluffy & made for a relaxing bath ....if only I could have gotten the bathtub to turn off completely. The bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Outstanding service at Texas-size golf resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast service was nice in Cafe on the Green. Food was good and the service was lovely. The bar was so-so and had a very limited wine menu for those wanting to order wine by the glass.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the Area

aka: Four Seasons Resort And Club Dallas At Las Colinas Hotel Irving
description: Located between Dallas and Fort Worth, we are the only AAA Five-Diamond resort in Texas, with a dedicated staff and gracious services that exude the relaxed warmth of a private country club - with no resort fee.
